context: The distances passengers need to move within a large airport <b3_0>can be substantial<b3_0/>. It is common for airports to provide moving walkways and <a0_0>buses<a0_0/>. <b4_0><b7_0>The <a1_0>Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport<b7_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> has a tram that takes people through the concourses and baggage claim. Major airports with more than one terminal offer <b5_0>inter-terminal transportation<b5_0/>, such as <a2_0>Mexico City International Airport<a2_0/>, where the domestic building of Terminal 1 is <b6_0>connected by Aerotrén to Terminal 2<b6_0/>, on the other side of the airport.
